alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Letcher; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Letcher, northeastern Perry, Knott, south central Floyd and southwestern Pike Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 807 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Carrie, or near Hindman, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hindman around 810 PM EDT. Leburn, Amburgey, Smithsboro, Soft Shell and Yellow Mountain around 815 PM EDT. Ivis, Brinkley, Mallie, Garner, Littcarr, Dirk, Carr Creek, Cody and Redfox around 820 PM EDT. Bath, Pippa Passes, Pine Top, Spider, Hollybush, Larkslane and Amelia around 825 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
